name: TextTrack
description: The TextTrack interface—part of the API for handling WebVTT (text tracks on media presentations)—describes and controls the text track associated with a particular <track> element. Properties This interface also inherits properties from EventTarget.

members.name: TextTrack.activeCues
members.description: A TextTrackCueList object listing the currently active set of text track cues. Track cues are active if the current playback position of the media is between the cues' start and end times.

members.name: TextTrack.cues
members.description: A TextTrackCueList which contains all of the track's cues.

members.name: TextTrack.id
members.description: A DOMString which identifies the track, if it has one. If it doesn't have an ID, then this value is an empty string (""). If the TextTrack is associated with a <track> element, then the track's ID matches the element's ID.

members.name: TextTrack.inBandMetadataTrackDispatchType
members.description: Returns a DOMString which indicates the track's in-band metadata track dispatch type. needs details

members.name: TextTrack.kind
members.description: Returns a DOMString indicating what kind of text track the TextTrack describes. The value must be one of those in the TextTrackKind enum.

members.name: TextTrack.label
members.description: A human-readable DOMString which contains the text track's label, if one is present; otherwise, this is an empty string (""), in which case a custom label may need to be generated by your code using other attributes of the track, if the track's label needs to be exposed to the user.

members.name: TextTrack.language
members.description: A DOMString which specifies the text language in which the text track's contents is written. The value must adhere to the format specified in the Tags for Identifying Languages (BCP 47) document from the IETF, just like the HTML lang attribute. For example, this can be "en-US" for United States English or "pt-BR" for Brazilian Portuguese.

members.name: TextTrack.mode
members.description: A DOMString specifying the track's current mode. Changing this property's value changes the track's current mode to match. Permitted values are listed under Text track mode constants below.

parameters.name: "disabled"
parameters.description: The text track is currently disabled. While the track's presence is exposed in the DOM, the user agent is otherwise ignoring it. No cues are active, no events are being fired, and the user agent won't attempt to obtain the track's cues.

parameters.name: "hidden"
parameters.description: The text track is currently active but the cues aren't being displayed. If the user agent hasn't tried to obtain the track's cues yet, it will do so soon (thereby populating the track's TextTrack.cues property). The user agent is keeping a list of the active cues (in the track's activeCues property) and events are being fired at the corresponding times, even though the text isn't being displayed.

parameters.name: "showing"
parameters.description: The text track is currently enabled and is visible. If the track's cues list hasn't been obtained yet, it will be soon. The activeCues list is being maintained and events are firing at the appropriate times; the track's text is also being drawn appropriately based on the styling and the track's kind.

members.name: TextTrack.oncuechange
members.description: A EventHandler specifying a function to be called when a cuechange event occurs. Handling these events lets you know when cues are entered and exited. A given text cue appears when the cue is entered and disappears when the cue is exited.

members.name: TextTrack.addCue()
members.description: Adds a cue (specified as a TextTrackCue object to the track's list of cues.

members.name: TextTrack.removeCue()
members.description: Removes a cue (specified as a TextTrackCue object from the track's list of cues.
